-e ---

Hebrew ה letter h < ch < the? ₪

causative from nouns / article for nouns
𓈍 הִכְתִּיר hikhtír coronate <= כ־ת־ר k-t-r kéter “crown”

ה existence article “he who has” see:
Hebrew: הָיָה hayá (be sei)
Hindi: होना honā < 𓃹 wnna
Egyptian: 𓃹𓃺 HaBen/HaSen being > wnn
Greek: ὑπάρχω hupárkhō ὑπόκειμαι hupókeimai

In general one can take (semitic) words and remove the ה ha- hy- ὑ prefix to obtain roots in other languages.
Similar to µ ma-

humid mwt wet/water

𓎛 𓈖 𓎡 𓏏 𓋳 bed ה𓎛night ganitli ᎦᏂᏟ nest?

𓂋 𓅱 𓂧 𓌗 hard הrigid < kräftig (𓂋 corn)

NA2 𒈿 Nacht…Tuch? bed

𓎛 𓃀 𓋴 𓋳 הboso l'ḇūš 𐎍𐎁𐎌 lbš לְבוּשׁ ləḇūš @ Leibes ?
